result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Thomas R. Goretski

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
10:30 a.m. Defendant Thomas R Goretski in court with attorney Casey James Hoff. David R. Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Cases heard today for Plea & Sentencing: 13CF327, 13CT298, 13CT305, 14CF376. (13TR4002 is a city ticket to be DRI).
14CF376 is addressed as an initial, Preliminary waiver, Arraignment, P/NG and state recommends to be Dismissed Read In.

Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed.
Prosecutor states plea agreement.
 13CF327: I/S Sentence: Prison 3 yrs In & 3 yrs ES-Stayed: 3 yrs Probation: Conditions: 360 days conditional jail w/electronic monitor (has serious medical conditions), $2,400 fine + costs, $33.33 Blood Draw, 36 mo Revocation, 36 mo IID, AODA/DOT safety plan,  AODA, unless already completed while in the Pretrial Supervision Program &/or continue complying with treatment recommendations.  Engage and comply in any other counseling reasonably related to the offense as recommended by the Agent.  Do not operate a vehicle without a valid driver's license and comply with license restrictions. 
 13CT298, 13CT305, 14CF376 to be DRI
Attorney for Defendant concurs with agreement stated.

Atty Hoff has expert witness, Dr. William Benn, appears by phone and is sworn in and gives testimony during direct exam.  No cross exam.
Defendant enters a plea of: 
13CF327 Ct 1 OWI 6th: No Contest

Court questions Defendant regarding plea.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions Attorney for Defendant.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Attorney stipulate that there is factual basis for the charge(s).

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charge(s).
Court finds the defendant guilty 13CF327 count 1.  Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Conviction this date.  13CT298, 13CT305, 13TR4002, and 14CF376 are dismissed read in. 13CF327 count 2 is dismissed.

ADA Knaapen states victim was notified.  State has no objection to electronic monitor especially for the medical issues of the Defendant. Restitution was taken care of by the Defendant's insurance.
Atty Hoff concurs with agreement and states reasons for the sentencing agreement.

******************PROBATION************
13CF327: OWI 6th  I/S Sentence: Prison 3 yrs In & 3 yrs ES-Stayed: 
3 yrs Probation: 
Condition of Probation: 
360 days conditional jail.  Huber privileges are granted pursuant to Sec. 303.08(1) Stats. and subject to the rules of the Portage County Sheriff's Department. Court will allow first 6 months and balance on electronic monitor or if Sheriff finds that Defendant's medical attention is more important, the Court will waive the first 6 months condition and place on electronic monitor sooner if needed. 3 days credit. Sentence to commence within 60 days. Must report today for start date.
$2,400 fine + costs (bond in files will be applied)
$33.33 Blood Draw 
36 mo Revocation
36 mo IID 
AODA/DOT safety plan 
AODA & comply with any assessments if Agent recommends, unless already completed while in the Pretrial Supervision Program &/or continue complying with treatment recommendations.  
Engage and comply in any other counseling reasonably related to the offense as recommended by the Agent.  
Do not operate a vehicle without a valid driver's license and comply with license restrictions.  

IID Exemption form is signed by the Court to exempt all mopeds.

ADA David Knaapen appears in Court.  
Defendant appears from jail by video.

ADA Knaapen states facts for anticipated charges of Felony Bail Jumping.
Court finds probable cause that a crime has been committed and that this defendant committed it.
Court informs Defendant right to an attorney and/or Public Defender.
Court questions Defendant. 
State requests a $500 cash bond with conditions as stated.

Initial Appearance Scheduled for:  10/21/14  @ 10:30 a.m.  in Branch 1 (tracking with 13CF327)
Comply with all conditions set forth in all other cases.
